intro: Draba elisabethae, commonly known as the Elisabeth's rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Draba elisabethae typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine flora, adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
